overview: This documentary exposes the wild, untold history of LGBT activism in ultra-conservative Texas and its impact on the national stage as told by the movement's ultimate outsider, Ray Hill: a labor activists' son, ex-con, and "loud-mouthed queer," whose 50 years of fearlessly protesting for LGBTQ equality energized a grassroots movement to take powerful, political action.
title: Loud Mouth Queer
